about_the_game:
An amnesiac astronaut wakes up disoriented after an unscheduled landing in an unknown location among the cosmos. Who are you? Where are you? And why are you here? Something calls, the star of the void awaits...



Descend into the depths of the event horizon with the assistance of The Motherboard, an artificial intelligence that miraculously survived the crash. Regain the memories of the astronaut as you fight through the deserted Outer, the lush Inner, and the crystalized Center.
Wield the state-of-the-art Nexus-BHG, or Nexus-Black Hole Gun, a powerful hunk of metal capable of harnessing and condensing a black hole's power into a single burst.
When all else fails, the astronaut may upgrade their standard-issued blaster to make an attempt at rivaling the Nexus-BHG's strength.

Anomalies
Unidentified alien lifeforms who inhabit the dark crevices of the event horizon, varying from humanly familiar to formlessly obscure. The astronaut must find and scan these creatures to learn more about them. Are they intelligent? Why can they speak? One will watch the astronaut walk by while the other clings to the astronauts legs. These multi-classed enemies will vary in threat level and the astronaut must dispose of them as they see fit. Be warned.

The Omniscanner
A device attached to the astronaut’s gauntlet allows them to scan all life forms found in the event horizon and give real-time analysis of the objects scanned. All data is tracked in the Logbook, and information is secretly sent back to Earth without the astronaut knowing it.

The Logbook (LOG)
The Logbook, also called The LOG, is a device attached to the astronaut that is an extension of The Motherboard. This device stores and retrieves data on everything the astronaut has scanned with the Omniscanner. Additionally, it allows the astronaut to tap into the functions of The Motherboard without being directly on the spacecraft. The Logbook is programmed to send information back to The Motherboard and keep track of the astronaut's health.

The Quantum Stabilizer
A device that can stabilize The ███████████, and prevent it from growing or consuming nearby matter. This device is a container that has the ability to capture, manipulate and utilize quantum forces.

The Tachyon Translocator
A radar device that allows the astronaut to track pulses of high-frequency electromagnetic waves that are reflected off the object back to the source. The astronaut may utilize this device to to track rifts in time and space, allowing for travel between layers of the black hole through The Motherboard's systems.

The ███████████
An unknown entity known to be “the center of space and time.” Local anomalies do not know much about this being other than the fact that it exists and resides deep within the layers of the event horizon. The ███████████ is also rumored to hold cosmic powers, including the ability to reverse time.

name: Event Horizon

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit (version 1909 or higher)
  • Processor: Intel Core i3-8100 or AMD Ryzen 3 1300X
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 4GB or AMD Radeon RX 5500 XT 4GB
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit (version 1909 or higher)
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-8600 or AMD Ryzen 5 3600
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 or AMD Radeon RX 5600
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

short_description: Event Horizon is an action-adventure sci-fi shooter with the heart of souls-like utilizing gun modification and first-person scanning to explore the unknown depths of the cosmos.
